bioghist.p: The McMillans served as missionaries in Iran from 1945 to 1960 under the auspices of the Board of Foreign Missions of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. From 1956 to 1960, Ernest McMillan was the chaplain at St. Christopherâ€™s Church, Abadan, Iran. The congregation included overseas personnel of the National Refining Oil Company/Iranian Oil Refining Company.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of several volumes of a journal compiled by Ernest and June McMillan describing their missionary work in Iran. The journal includes a narrative history of their journey and of their postings in several locations in Iran, histories of the stations, and broader historical and cultural descriptions. Items in the journal are original and photocopied photographs and photocopies of clippings and correspondence. There is also a scrapbook from the McMillans' time in Iran, which includes clippings, brochures and pamphlets, church notices, correspondence, oil company bulletins, short reminiscences, church notices, and ephemera.
